title: Suggest: square or mechanical sans serifs
content:
Hey people,

I have been asked to suggest a couple of typefaces for setting the book that is being published by my art and design school for this years graduating students. The students that are designing it, were thinking about using FF DIN for it. But they sort of asked me as ’type consultant’ to give them some alternatives.

I want to suggest a few typefaces that have a similar square and mechanical look, but with a more humanistic touch, so to speak.

I’m thinking about typefaces like [Flama](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821152510/http:/www.felicianotypefoundry.com/main/?page_id=10) and [Apex New](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821152510/http:/www.vllg.com/Thirstype/ApexNew/mudTyper+Weights/). They have a similar feel, but are less rigid. So typefaces like Klavika are too square.

I have a few others in mind, but I’m hoping you guys can point me to some typefaces I might otherwise overlook.

Thanks!

 [‹ SOS! Boat Name font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821152510/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44361 "Go to previous forum topic") [STAX LOGO - Font identification – Help! ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821152510/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44357 "Go to next forum topic")

have a look at this thread: [Attack of the Square Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821152510/http:/typophile.com/node/28458).

I knew that Attack of the thread. But some of them are a bit too square. I guess maybe square isn’t the right description. I meant it in the way DIN is square (like its characters look like they fit into a rectangle).

Hello Quincunx,

You could take a look at [Soho Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821152510/http:/www.monotypefonts.com/sg).  
It was released this week.

Seb Lester, thanks for the reply. I actually have your Soho Gothic on my list, since I think it’s a great typeface. Congrats on the release. :)

Stephen, thanks once again for the suggestions.

Jan: Had Stainless written down already. But thanks nevertheless. :)
